articles.headline: Foods Loaded With Sugar, Salt and Fat? Bring It
articles.snippet: As definitions of what’s healthy change, consumers are turning back to ingredients they once avoided, and manufacturers are rushing to catch up.
articles.abstract: As definitions of what’s healthy change, consumers are turning back to ingredients they once avoided, and manufacturers are rushing to catch up.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAKERSFIELD, Calif. — Dark chocolate is in. So, too, is beef jerky. And full-fat ice cream? You bet.

articles.headline: Fantasy Math Is Helping Companies Spin Losses Into Profits
articles.snippet: Numbers in financial reports differ from reality more often, raising the question of whether investors truly understand the businesses they own.
articles.abstract: Numbers in financial reports differ from reality more often, raising the question of whether investors truly understand the businesses they own.
articles.lead_paragraph: Companies, if granted the leeway, will surely present their financial results in the best possible light. And of course they will try to persuade investors that the calculations they prefer, in which certain costs are excluded, best represent the reality in their operations.

articles.headline: Renewable Energy Stumbles Toward the Future
articles.snippet: The problems at companies like SunEdison resemble those of past leading-edge industries.
articles.abstract: The problems at companies like SunEdison resemble those of past leading-edge industries.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was just last summer that SunEdison was a Wall Street darling, the very air around the fast-growing company seeming to shimmer with potential.
articles.byline: By Julie Creswell and Diane Cardwell

articles.headline: Wrestling Propelled Hastert’s Career, and Provided Opportunity for Abuse
articles.snippet: As sentencing approaches for J. Dennis Hastert on charges of secret payments over sexual abuse, the wrestling community feels a sense of betrayal.
articles.abstract: As sentencing approaches for J. Dennis Hastert on charges of secret payments over sexual abuse, the wrestling community feels a sense of betrayal.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When calls for his removal from office reverberated through the capital a decade ago, Speaker J. Dennis Hastert struggled to explain why he had not aggressively investigated allegations that a Florida lawmaker had sent flirtatious messages to a teenage boy who had served as a House page.
articles.byline: By Eric Lipton and Monica Davey

articles.headline: Investigators Say Mexico Has Thwarted Efforts to Solve Students’ Disappearance
articles.snippet: International experts brought to Mexico to investigate the disappearance of 43 students say they have faced sustained harassment and stonewalling.
articles.abstract: International experts brought to Mexico to investigate the disappearance of 43 students say they have faced sustained harassment and stonewalling.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — An international panel of experts brought to Mexico to investigate the haunting disappearance of 43 students that ignited a global outcry say they cannot solve the case because of a sustained campaign of harassment, stonewalling and intimidation against them.
articles.byline: By Azam Ahmed and Paulina Villegas

articles.headline: On Encryption Battle, Apple Has Advocates in Ex-National Security Officials
articles.snippet: More than a half-dozen prominent former national security officials support Apple in the debate over balancing privacy and security in the digital age.
articles.abstract: More than a half-dozen prominent former national security officials support Apple in the debate over balancing privacy and security in the digital age.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In their years together as top national security officials, Michael V. Hayden and Michael Chertoff were fierce advocates of using the government’s spying powers to pry into sensitive intelligence data.

articles.headline: U.S. Opens Another iPhone, This Time With the Keycode
articles.snippet: The Justice Department dropped its bid to force Apple to unlock a smartphone tied to a Brooklyn drug case after someone provided the keycode.
articles.abstract: The Justice Department dropped its bid to force Apple to unlock a smartphone tied to a Brooklyn drug case after someone provided the keycode.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Justice Department said Friday night that it had gained access on its own to a locked iPhone used by a Brooklyn drug dealer, the second time in less than a month that it had unlocked such a device after initially insisting it could do so only with Apple’s help.

articles.headline: Hillary Clinton’s Campaign, Cautious but Confident, Begins Considering Running Mates
articles.snippet: As her team begins compiling a list, Mrs. Clinton is said to care less about ideological and personal compatibility than about picking a winner.
articles.abstract: As her team begins compiling a list, Mrs. Clinton is said to care less about ideological and personal compatibility than about picking a winner.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton’s advisers and allies have begun extensive discussions about who should be her running mate, seeking to compile a list of 15 to 20 potential picks for her team to start vetting by late spring.

articles.headline: In an Age of Privilege, Not Everyone Is in the Same Boat
articles.snippet: Companies are becoming adept at identifying wealthy customers and marketing to them, creating a money-based caste system.
articles.abstract: Companies are becoming adept at identifying wealthy customers and marketing to them, creating a money-based caste system.
articles.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — Behind a locked door aboard Norwegian Cruise Line’s newest ship is a world most of the vessel’s 4,200 passengers will never see. And that is exactly the point.

articles.headline: Jimmy Buffett’s ‘Margaritaville’ Is a State of Mind, and an Empire
articles.snippet: The singer’s company is expanding offerings in lodging, alcohol, licensing and media, and the appeal extends well beyond Parrot Heads.
articles.abstract: The singer’s company is expanding offerings in lodging, alcohol, licensing and media, and the appeal extends well beyond Parrot Heads.
articles.lead_paragraph: His newest showstopper, a 17-story hotel near Miami, has three pools, a full-service spa and eight restaurants, including a seriously upscale steakhouse. That electric blue sculpture in the lobby? You’d swear it was by Jeff Koons.

articles.headline: An Amateur vs. ISIS: A Car Salesman Investigates and Ends Up in Prison
articles.snippet: Toby Lopez, a Delaware man, spent nearly 14 months in federal custody after he repeatedly reported online exchanges with people he believed to be terrorists.
articles.abstract: Toby Lopez, a Delaware man, spent nearly 14 months in federal custody after he repeatedly reported online exchanges with people he believed to be terrorists.
articles.lead_paragraph: WYOMING, Del. — By his own account, Toby Lopez was a supremely ordinary guy. He sold Toyotas and lived with his mother in a tidy rancher here with a cherry tree out front. He was proud that he could connect with customers — anyone from a Superior Court judge to, as he put it, “Redneck Bill from down on the farm.” What passed for excitement was the time his young niece won a beauty contest and he chauffeured her in a red Corvette in a local parade.

articles.headline: Donald Trump’s Aging Air Fleet Gives His Bid, and His Brand, a Lift
articles.snippet: A look at Mr. Trump’s airplanes and helicopters suggests that their value rests chiefly in their marketing potential, with the candidate’s stamp of status masking an aging fleet.
articles.abstract: A look at Mr. Trump’s airplanes and helicopters suggests that their value rests chiefly in their marketing potential, with the candidate’s stamp of status masking an aging fleet.
articles.lead_paragraph: Of all the things connected to Donald J. Trump, few have given him more mileage than his fleet of aircraft.

articles.headline: Politico Pierces the ‘Brussels Bubble’ With U.S.-Style Coverage
articles.snippet: The European outpost of the American political publication is bringing flood-the-zone reporting to the heart of the E.U., rankling some in the establishment.
articles.abstract: The European outpost of the American political publication is bringing flood-the-zone reporting to the heart of the E.U., rankling some in the establishment.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — The offices of Politico Europe, the Brussels outpost of the American political news organization, are less than a five-minute walk from the Maelbeek subway station where a suicide bomber killed more than a dozen people in the terrorist attacks here last month.

articles.headline: Was Your Dog Walked? Your Phone Can Show You
articles.snippet: On-demand businesses like Uber have changed customers’ expectations, and the kinds of real-time maps the ride-hailing company uses are spreading to other services.
articles.abstract: On-demand businesses like Uber have changed customers’ expectations, and the kinds of real-time maps the ride-hailing company uses are spreading to other services.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Some parents find peace of mind in the location-tracking features in smartphones that let them keep tabs on their children. There are also the dog owners who can rest easy knowing that hired dog walkers are doing their job, and that the dogs are doing their business.

articles.headline: U.S. Cyberattacks Target ISIS in a New Line of Combat
articles.snippet: The military has been told to mount computer-network attacks against the group, which has proved effective at modern communications and encryption.
articles.abstract: The military has been told to mount computer-network attacks against the group, which has proved effective at modern communications and encryption.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The United States has opened a new line of combat against the Islamic State, directing the military’s six-year-old Cyber Command for the first time to mount computer-network attacks that are now being used alongside more traditional weapons.

articles.headline: Theranos’s Fate Rests With a Founder Who Answers Only to Herself
articles.snippet: Under criminal investigation and with skepticism about its core technology rising, a onetime Silicon Valley favorite’s future is largely up to its founder, Elizabeth Holmes.
articles.abstract: Under criminal investigation and with skepticism about its core technology rising, a onetime Silicon Valley favorite’s future is largely up to its founder, Elizabeth Holmes.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s all up to Elizabeth Holmes.

articles.headline: Bernie Sanders and Allies Aim to Shape Democrats’ Agenda After Primaries
articles.snippet: Senator Bernie Sanders and his allies are trying to use his popularity to expand his political influence, setting up an ideological struggle for the party’s soul.
articles.abstract: Senator Bernie Sanders and his allies are trying to use his popularity to expand his political influence, setting up an ideological struggle for the party’s soul.
articles.lead_paragraph: Even as his chances of winning the Democratic presidential nomination slip away, Senator Bernie Sanders and his allies are trying to use his popularity to expand his political influence, setting up an ideological struggle for the soul of the Democratic Party in the post-Obama era.

articles.headline: Facebook Aims to Drive Down Tech Prices to Expand Its Reach
articles.snippet: The social network wants to triple its 1.6 billion global users, but to do that, it will have to make connecting to the Internet much less expensive.
articles.abstract: The social network wants to triple its 1.6 billion global users, but to do that, it will have to make connecting to the Internet much less expensive.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Mark Zuckerberg, Facebook’s co-founder and chief executive, is clear about his vision for his company: He wants to triple the size of his social network, which now has 1.6 billion members.
articles.byline: By Quentin Hardy and Mike Isaac

articles.headline: Missing Mexican Students Suffered a Night of ‘Terror,’ Investigators Say
articles.snippet: An international panel has provided details of the night in 2014 when Mexican police and gunmen abducted 43 students who have not been seen since.
articles.abstract: An international panel has provided details of the night in 2014 when Mexican police and gunmen abducted 43 students who have not been seen since.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — Municipal police officers encircled the bus, detonated tear gas, punctured the tires and forced the college students who were onboard to get off.

articles.headline: In This Snapchat Campaign, Election News Is Big and Then It’s Gone
articles.snippet: In this election season, the photo- and video-sharing app acts as a reset button, allowing audiences to see and quickly forget misbehavior.
articles.abstract: In this election season, the photo- and video-sharing app acts as a reset button, allowing audiences to see and quickly forget misbehavior.
articles.lead_paragraph: Every modern presidential election is at least in part defined by the cool new media breakthrough of its moment. In 2000, there was email, and by golly was that a big change from the fax. The campaigns could get their messages in front of print and cable news reporters — who could still dominate the campaign narrative — at will, reducing what had been a 24-hour news cycle to an hourly one.

articles.headline: How Argentina Settled a Billion-Dollar Debt Dispute With Hedge Funds
articles.snippet: A six-week flurry of secret negotiations resulted in a deal that ended 15 years of contention between bondholders and government officials.
articles.abstract: A six-week flurry of secret negotiations resulted in a deal that ended 15 years of contention between bondholders and government officials.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Waldorf Astoria hotel in Manhattan has long been a location for secret diplomacy, but few meetings there would have seemed as unlikely as the one that took place one day in early December.

articles.headline: Ted Cruz and John Kasich to Coordinate Against Donald Trump
articles.snippet: The campaign rivals agreed to coordinate in future primary contests in a last-ditch effort to deny Mr. Trump the Republican presidential nomination.
articles.abstract: The campaign rivals agreed to coordinate in future primary contests in a last-ditch effort to deny Mr. Trump the Republican presidential nomination.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Ted Cruz and Gov. John R. Kasich of Ohio have agreed to coordinate in future primary contests in a last-ditch effort to deny Donald J. Trump the Republican presidential nomination, with each candidate standing aside in certain states amid growing concerns that Mr. Trump cannot otherwise be stopped.
articles.byline: By Matt Flegenheimer and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: North Carolina Restroom Law Becomes a Central Election Issue
articles.snippet: The law, a cultural and economic battle, is now a political one as well, affecting the state’s contests for governor and other major offices.
articles.abstract: The law, a cultural and economic battle, is now a political one as well, affecting the state’s contests for governor and other major offices.
articles.lead_paragraph: HIGH POINT, N.C. — Parrish Clodfelter, a 79-year-old retiree who lives on a central North Carolina farm, professes opinions about transgender people that might get him fired if he worked for a multinational corporation, though for many here, they constitute simple country wisdom.
